title: Porsche Mission R: The All-Electric Future of Racing?
sub_head: Once gas-powered engines are banned, how will Porsche keep its lucrative club-racing business alive? The Mission R is a first stab at the answer.
body:
FOUR THOUSANDS of racing enthusiasts around the world, the North Pole is a bloc of nondescript office towers in Weissach, Germany— Porsche ’s research and development campus, about a half-hour’s drive from the Hauptbahnhof in Stuttgart.
Weissach is the home of what Porsche calls “customer racing.” From here Saint Nick (Die Weihnachten Gruppenführer) will overnight-ship anything you or your race engineer desires—engines and transmissions; spares, from headlamps to wicker bills; and even whole cars, like the 911 GT3 Cup, 911 GT3 R and 718 Cayman GT4 RS Clubsport, fully credentialed for international racing. Hell, Porsche factory elves are even available to help on race weekends.
